Reviews.Title: “A hotel who cared”
Reviews.Author: margaret h
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the nicest I have used for some time, as soon as you arrive the greeting makes you feel at home. the bedrooms are spacious enough for two and all have a chaise longe on which to relax, they are tastefully decorated and inviting. The bathroom, although tighly packed, has everything you need for your stay and if not you only have to telephone reception.. Continental breakfast is served in a very tastefully decorated dining room on the first floor with staff available to attend to your every need, there is more to eat than any other buffet breakfast I have seen or experienced for a long time at the price paid and it was very good too. Margaret Hook Very central hotel right on the Grand Canal, and near to the bus station where you bus arrives from the Marco Polo airport,

Reviews.Title: “The Arlecchino Hotel : Venice”
Reviews.Author: Pedro258
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Arlecchino after an interim of 6 years If visiting Venice from Trevisio Airport ( and catching the coach into Venice) I found this Hotel most useful as it is at the top end of the Grand Canal just opposite the Coach arrivals. My friend also joined us via Train and he also found it very easy to locate The room was a clean room with clean linen, Ideally I was hoping for a room facing the canal and the specs wasnt quite what I was expecting: We were in a room called the quadrangular rrom : there were two rooms in the suite, both had sun roofs for windows. Anyhow this was offset by the brilliant service. The Front desk service run by Marco, Jaamie and Francesco is excellent and very helpful. The breakfast is plenty but does take a bit getting used to as the table space is minimal + The waitress is very loud ! Overall a worthy reccomendation

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Janet-MaryP
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very friendly & helpful. Our room was comfortable & breakfast good. The decor was attractive. Sheets and towels were changed daily. The position of the hotel was ideal for us - close to Piazzale Roma - bus & vaporetti stops - but not noisy although right on a busy canal. Good restaurants & some 'sights' within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Sara S
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautiful, the staff very helpful, and it's just minutes from the bus depot and train station. The breakfast was great, by far the best one of the hotels we stayed at during our trip, and there was a great coffee shop right next door as well. Ask about the free taxi ride to Murano for the glass tour.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Venetian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjuk7
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 12pm before check in time but our room was ready and waiting. What a surprise it was a charming room full of character. I had emailed the hotel ahead of our visit to ask if possible to have a canal view as it was my husbands birthday and our wedding anniversary. we received a fast response and they delivered what I had requested. The hotel were also very helpful with a full list of options for getting from the airport. The hotel was so easy to find, we could see it when we got of the bus, two small bridges and your there. Reception was very helpful, it seems in Venice it isn't the standard continental plug adaptor, no problem the hotel loaned us one. Some people have said the breakfast room is small, it's not that small and there was no problem as they asked you each day for your prefered breakfast slot. The breakfast was continental style but plenty of choice. The room was charming and clean, each day the soaps and bubble bath etc were topped up, plenty of clothes hanging space etc. The location is excellent and for us each day was a different walk to St Marks Square we found so many variations of the walk it was so interesting. All in all well worth a visit and would certainly recommend this hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay”
Reviews.Author: miniphantom
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel enough, my wife and I spent five days here, its a one minute walk from bus station and is easily seen from bus station, the staff could not do enough to help, the room looked onto the canal and was just what you would expect in Venice, full of character and charm, perfectly situated to see all the sights, when we ever get the chance to go back this hotel will be our first choice, our stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: DonnaSebastian
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! This hotel was only about a 10 minute walk from the bus station and train station. You are just around the corner from the water taxi. The staff was very helpful, the room was absolutely delightful, the beds were comfortable,and the breakfast was in a lovely little room with wonderful choices of food. I have seen a number of reviews that say this hotel is out of the center of everything, but if you know Venice, you know that no matter where you are you are not far from anything. The best thing about Venice is that you walk everywhere, and nothing is far away. And, if you don't want to walk just take the water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in an outstanding city”
Reviews.Author: JimK42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Arlecchino Venizia. We arrived by air and took a bus from the airport to Venice. Hotel Arlecchino was very close to ,the bus terminal where you could walk to the hotel. You did have to traverse 2 sets of stairs going over a canal but being that it was so close it was doable. There were 9 rooms, all different, some with views, some without. There was one room accross from ours that you had to go outside your room to it's bathroom. We stayed with 4 other couples so that is how we got to see more than just our room. I t was a very comfortable stay, it is not a Hyatt or Hilton but it was very adequate. Request a canal view when you book and hopefully you will get one with a view. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were comfortable and decent bathrooms. The hotel was close enough to a Vapporetta station that you could walk to the station. Buy a pass so that you can jump on and off at anytime and also ride them at night when you can see the Grand Canal. There were many little restaurants around the hotel with fixed menus for $12 Euros. The breakfast at the hotel was plenty with us taking some nibbles for later in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jglaserjr
Reviews.Content: Great location, ideal for cruise ship passengers looking to spend the night before or after a cruise. Rooms were clean and service was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and a great location”
Reviews.Author: LSKMK40
Reviews.Content: You wont get lost finding the hotel from the bus or railway station and it is brilliantly located for walking or water buses. As it is so neare Piazalle Roma all the signs in the city point you the way home which is very helpful after a long day in the incredibly confusing alleyways of the city. We had a larger room which was clean and had canal views. Some of the rooms looked a little too cosy but we even had a bath! The breakfast room is tiny but adequate and the reception staff were friendly and helpful. Not trendy or luxurious but good value and an excellent location which means you wont have to trudge endlessly through the crowded city trying to find your hotel like many tourists we saw.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Venetian stay”
Reviews.Author: MelissaP536
Reviews.Content: This place is a gem, apparently one of only three hotels in Venice with a lift, is situated near the main train station and multi storey pay carpark. Has great views and is walking distance to anywhere in Venice! Has a fe nice restaurances nearby so dont need to go far at night for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Close to parking”
Reviews.Author: Anne H
Reviews.Content: What we like about this hotel was the ease of reaching it from the airport. The bus ride was easy and the hotel is a short walk and a bridge to cross and you are there. Our room though small was on the canal with a corner view. Interesting way to shower with a shower curtain. Still don't understand that one. But a complimentary boat to Murano and the water taxis were easy to navigate. One more thing you should also know that if you are taking the train out of Venice you must cross a very large bridge which is not that easy with luggage. Fortunately we had several men in our group to handle this.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Carol D
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very conveniently located within walking distance of the 2 large parking facilities. Although the room was not very large, it was perfect for our 2 night stay. Arlecchino was charming cozy and very clean. The staff was courteous, attentive, pleasant and extremely helpful. Francesco, the manager, was very friendly and informative. I would stay there on my next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: BillVanAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Arlecchino is located on the conjunction of three busy canals and water traffic bustled below my window all day and through to the late evening. The view from my top floor room was charming. The surrounding buildings are are stuccoed and painted in the most vibrant of colours. The room was small but enchanting. Possibly, some 700 years ago, it had been servant's quarters ;) The oak-beamed ceiling gave it a charm missing in modern hotels. Front of house, Francesco, the receptionist was very helpful. He loves his home town and will do everything to help guests enjoy it as much as he obviously does. His English is impeccable. Breakfast was good and substantial. The walk to the main attractions from the hotel is an adventure well worth the effort, although for the less able, the water bus stop is 3 minutes walk from the hotel. It is not, however, for the low-budget/no-budget traveller...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: folkart-films
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, comfortable, perfectly positioned near the Pzza dell Roma and charming in every way. Breakfast was standard contintental fair, but fresh and plentiful. Staff was very friendly and accomidating...multilingual front desk. ...only odd thing was that there was no shower curtain or inclosure around the tub shower...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for price”
Reviews.Author: Vcmazzei
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in Arlecchino for 3 rainy days and the overall assessment is an excellent value for the price. It is very close to piazza dell roma (Airport shuttle and train station) but a bit far from piazza San Marco but this has no problem at all since one of the best things to do at Venezia is to walk around. Also during high tides (we got 115mm) there was no problem around or on the way to train station. The attendants were handy and nice and the breakfast is ok. The decoration is a bit over fashion but everything clean and working. The only downside is that the shower did not have any curtain or glass door so after shower the floor was soaked, but nothing you can't live with.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Comfortable in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: 82sammy
Reviews.Content: Our 2 night stay over last weekend was a pleasant one at Arlecchino. What we liked best: 5 minute walk to the train station, far from the overwhelming crowds near St. Mark's and other tourist destinations, quick and easy access to 3 bridges into charming areas for a nice stroll or bite to eat, clean and well kept, comfortable bed with extra pillows available. Friendly and helpful staff were available for assistance and the complimentary breakfast is perfect for our needs, but the room is a bit small (it's Venice) but nicely decorated. Again, smaller rooms, but the bath is fine but for the lack of a shower curtain so be prepared for a wet floor to wipe up. No wash cloths provided so bring your own and Wi Fi was not available in our room so double check. For the price, still a bit steep but average for Venice. Once last note - it's nice to reserve a canal view room, but bring ear plugs if you plan to leave the windows cracked open. There's quite a bit of boat traffic. Overall, we recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Varadero35
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights before our trip back to USA. Extremely good location in Roma Piazzale. Rooms are very small but good restaurants around makes this a budget hotel to choose while in Venice. Vaporeto ( public transportation) were very close and accesible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to all transportation”
Reviews.Author: DTCT
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights before a cruise in September. Location was just what we required - near bus from airport, near Santa Lucia train station, near People Mover to cruise pier. Very easy to find from Piazzale Roma. Rooms were very small but clean. Pretty views of canal from the windows. Breakfast room small but staff attentive; good assortment of food. Front desk staff pleasant and helpful. Several restaurants nearby. Wifi access. Perfectly fine 3-star for a short stay; would be a bit cramped for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful things in small packages!”
Reviews.Author: Robert F
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Venice and to be honest I was not excited about going back. Our three night stay at Arlecchino Hotel did much to change my feelings about Venice. This hotel is just steps from the "People Mover" terminal that carried us from the Tronchetto Parking area; wheeling our own luggage was not a problem. The hotel is right on a small canal and only a short walk to the first Grand Canal vaporetto stop. The rooms were incredibly small and yet a pure delight! The rooms were spotless, the sheets were crisp, the breakfast was substantial, the service was exceptional, and the view from our rooms was a romantic dream come true. We did a great deal of walking and took several vaporetto rides and it was always a pleasure to return to our air-conditioned little room. In the afternoon we drank wine and snacked on fruit and cheese at the tables just outside the hotel doors before we headed off to a local restaurant for our evening meal. If we ever return to Venice we will look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location from P.Roma.”
Reviews.Author: MEME94
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after a seven-day cruise to the Greek Islands at the end of Sept. We selected it for its convenient easy to find location as we had several large suitcases with us. We took a taxi (20 Euros) from the dock for NCL Jade to P.Roma which only took about 10 minutes drive. Very nice cab driver took us as close as possible to the steps to our hotel. We arrived early around 10am and were allowed to check-in by 12 noon as soon as our room was ready. We left our luggage in the lobby while we walked around the area. There are several small restaurants (some on the canals) and souvenir shops very close by. The Vaporetto stop is a five min walk as well as the buses at P. Roma. The staff at the hotel is very nice and all the ones we met spoke English perfectly. We stayed on the 3rd floor in #801 which was very clean, spacious, had good storage and two large windows overlooking a side street , P.Roma, a restaurant and partial canal view. There was no noise from the surrounding area despite of being a very busy weekend in Venice. Loved the slower pace after the crowds and noise of St.Marks and Rialto areas. Lovely breakfast room offered delicious fare of croissants, breads, cold cuts, cheeses, juice and several coffee choices. The only negative was that the bathroom shower head had a leak and since there's no shower curtains or partitions in the tub/shower the floor got very wet everytime we showered. The price was high but the location and amenities were worth it to us considering we were there on a very busy weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Diane G
Reviews.Content: Was on a cruise and wanted to stay close. Researched and chose this this hotel and was happy we did. We took the express bus from airport to Piazza Roma and could see the hotel. It was charming. The staff was wonderful and helpful. We had room 811 on the third floor. It was large with king bed and modern bathroom. The breakfast room was charming with windows to see the canals. This hotel is so convenient to everything - the people mover - vaporettos and restaurants. It is so much nicer than staying with all the crowds at San Marco. We loved it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and easy to find from train station”
Reviews.Author: MnJAus
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in September at this hotel during our Venice trip. It was a 5 minute walk from the train station and easy to find which was ideal given our heavy luggage. Getting bus to/from airport is also very easy with the main bus stop literally next door. Venice is very difficult to navigate and easy to get lost down the many side alleys so I was happy with the location. Venice is small and easy to get around so I really don't think it matters where you stay in Venice as the fun part is just walking around. Anyway, Arlecchino Hotel is in a nice spot - lots of nice canals around and a strip of restaurants close by. Overall food wasn't that great in Venice so on our last night we just got a takeaway pizza which was much nicer and cheaper than the restaurant before. Cant remember the restaurant name (la "something") but it was recommended by hotel (not sure if they have deal going on), my wife had the scallop pasta with mushroom sauce which was the worst dish of the trip - dish was dry and tasteless. We had to ask if this was the right dish as we thought the sauce was missing but it was how was served so we had to ask for olive oil and chilli sauce to add flavour. This hotel was the best value I found on the internet but the room was super small but very nice with chandelier. Breakfast was good and simple. WiFi connection was good.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: briboard
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Arlecchino at the end of a Mediterranean cruise in late September 2011. To us, it was a very "old world" hotel with modern conveniences, including air conditioning. We rode the people mover from the cruise ship terminal and the hotel is only steps away....only two adjacent bridges to cross with your luggage. The bus terminal is between the people mover station and the hotel making airport transportation most convenient. Our room was very comfortable, but on the smallish side. The elevator is tiny and the hallways are narrow, but these things only add to the charm. The room had a full bathroom with a bidet, tub and shower but no shower curtain or provision for one. There are restaurants nearby and we thoroughly enjoyed our canal-side meal at the establishment recommended by the desk clerk. Very helpful and friendly multi-lingual staff and we were supplied with an excellent map of Venice. Breakfast is included but we were leaving early in the morning so breakfast boxes were prepared for us and ready at the front desk when we checked out. We were offered and accepted a free water taxi to a glass blowing establishment. While it was most interesting, we would not recommend this unless you're prepared to spend big money on glass. Additionally, the business is located on a separate island and if you aren't buying, you have to find your own way back. Our only regret is that we were not staying longer. The location is good and we found it easy to walk around Venice. We would recommend this hotel and stay there again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Hotel Ariecchino, Venice, Italy”
Reviews.Author: BritishColumbiaKathy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at Hotel Ariecchino from August 26 until August 29th. We had a nice room (small) but nice and had a view of the canals and the Piazzale Roma with all the action going on. The location is good. We were not on a cruise but didn't want to stay up in the old section of Venice as you have to haul your suitcases up so many different stairs. We did that a few years ago. We took the express bus from the airport and it stops right at the Piazzale Roma where you can see the hotel. It is near the vaporetto stop for the water buses and the train station. We took a train from Venice to Rome. Breakfast was good and you had to sign in as to what time you wanted to eat. Like most hotels in Italy, the rooms are a bit small but sufficient. Staff were very helpful. We couldn't get our wifi to work so used their free internet in the sister hotel. There were lots of restuarants near by. We walked up to St. Marks Square which was a bit of a walk but very interesting at the same time. You can always take a water bus one way. We would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: SusanDubai
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time reviewing hotels before I decided on Arlecchino Hotel for a pre cruise stay in August and we were very happy with our choice. We absolutely did not want the hassle of carrying our heavy bags over bridges and through the Venetian streets in the heat of summer. We took the express airport bus from the airport to Piazzale Roma - was planning on taking a taxi but as the bus goes direct to Piazzale Roma and at only only E7 per person, why pay Euro 40 in a taxi? The hotel was easy to find, over only one bridge on the other side of the Piazzale Roma, just a short walk away. We were sailing from San Basilo the next day so we were able to get a taxi from Piazzale Roma for Euro 15. The rooms are small (but this is typical in Venice), a bit dated but comfortable and clean, breakfast was included and the hotel had a lift (very welcome when you are carrying heavy bags). The location is excellent if you are cruising; on a quite street with a good choice of little restaurants close by which were probably a lot cheaper than in San Marco. We paid the extra for a canal view which was nice but since we were so exhausted after our trip and were in the room for such a short time, not sure if this was worth the extra. Would definitely recommend the hotel for a pre cruise stay. In fact if I was returning to Venice and wanted to stay away from the maddening crowd of San Marco area, I would still choose this hotel as the location is very peaceful and you can still explore the central attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad shower”
Reviews.Author: stockholm7
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel close to train station, around 5-7 min walk. Okay breakfast, they have a small room so you have to book a slot for breakfast. Good - Clean room, got an extra sofa bed which helped, location convenient to train station, you can get a canal view room if asked in advance (we asked for quiet room, so got one in the back) Bad - Shower had ZERO water pressure which we found out in the morning which was a big letdown. No luggage storage space, it sits in front of reception, which could be issue for some people

Reviews.Title: “pre stay to cruise”
Reviews.Author: JACFalkirkScotland
Reviews.Content: Arlechino Hotel is right next to bus station where you arrive from airport and also the people mover to take you to the cruise port within 2 minutes for one euro each. Therefore it it an ideal stop for one night or so however perhaps not for a longer visit. it is well position right at the top of grand canal and ideal for hopping onto vaperretto to go right down grand canal and view all the great sights. However the rooms are very small and would not make for a comfortable longer stay - we virtually had to climb over our suitcases due to lack of floor space - that said we did have great view over the two small canals directly outside the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: debrakpage
Reviews.Content: Excellent location by main bus station. Do stay near hear otherwise you will be dragging your case around all the little streets and over bridges and involve the expensive cost of water taxi's. Good location to explore everything, 30 mins lazy walk to St Marks, Rialto etc. Room was good. Air con a little noisy. Shower was pathetic, don't know if that was just our room but after long walks in the heat we really needed a good shower! Round the corner is a restaurant called Hostaria Venexina, 285 De Barnado (can't remember the whole street name). Very good restaruant, ate there 3 of 4 nights. Good price, excellent food and one of the rare places with no service or cover charge.

Reviews.Title: “Near the car parking, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Baltan
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel, booked via Expedia because we were traveling by car and the hotel was close to the parking space. The room was not spacious, but was OK. The breakfast room was small and we could not sit around the table by family of six, separated into two tables.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient in Venice”
Reviews.Author: caribe_chic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my friend for a single night before boarding a cruise. The hotel was very convenient for us, as we traveled to Venice by train and had quite a bit of luggage. Getting the luggage over the bridges was a pain, but once we walked in to Piazzale Roma, we were pleased with our selection in hotels. Taking the vaperetto to another hotel closer to St. Mark's would have been most annoying, and this hotel was conveniently located in relation to the people mover (monorail) that takes you to the cruise port. The hotel itself was comfortable, with a delicious breakfast (make sure you get it included in the rate when you book). We were put in room 905, which is the upstairs room with only skylights. I read a lot of reviews here in which people hated this room, but it was really great aside from having no windows. There were 2 really big bedrooms with queen sized beds with lots of closet space and a kitchenette with 2 stovetops and a fridge. The bathroom had a sloped ceiling, which made it a tad bit difficult when showering, but it was a pretty decent size. And yes, I agree with other reviews about there being no shower curtain: water gets everywhere. Take the hand-held shower head off the rack and use it manually; it will create much less mess. Around the hotel there are many places to eat and grab a drink. The vaperetto stop is just across the way and I highly recommend it. Buy a pass if you are going to be in the city for more than a day. It is well worth it. And, if you are under 29, you can get a discount pass. This hotel has a great location and good amenities given the price, and is away from the insane overcrowding of Piazza San Marco. Some tips are: buy a vaperetto pass if staying more than a day; and don't bother looking for eateries in San Marco, as they are overpriced tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and perfect for pre/post cruises”
Reviews.Author: cheddyanne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and friends stayed for a night prior to our cruise. We were able to get the ATVO bus direct from the airport to Plazzale Roma and the hotel is a mere few minutes walk, easy to drag the suitcases. The rooms are very small, but lovely views of the canals,spotlessly clean and comfortable and staff very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was excellent, you do need to book a time as the room is can only hold a certain number. From the hotel you only need to cross one bridge to walk up to the people mover, one stop (one euro) to the port. Needless to say, it is so lovely to walk around Venice, being at this end is no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Location is all”
Reviews.Author: travguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at both the Arlecchino and the next door Olimpia pre and post cruise. Like the other reviews found the staff friendly and helpful. Both are under the Best Western flag and it seeems they operate in conjunction. At each we had a tiny room but very clean and adequate. If both were available at the same price I would select the Olimpia because the breakfast was better, the breakfast room was larger and they had a pleasant garden and a small lounge where you could spend a while when waiting for bus/plane/boat etc. In any event the location is almost unbeatable and I saw one of the hotel staff carrying a guest's luggage over the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Dgoldenberg
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the bus station And walked across a bridge and there we were. Friendly staff allowed us to check in early, answered all our questions gave us a map and that was that. Breakfast was wonderful. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Duca22
Reviews.Content: We have arrived at 4 pm to the hotel and the most unfriendliest receptionist told us that she has cancelled our room because our credit card declined. Bookings.com has inforned us that they will hold the room till 6pm that day! She was not willing to help just left us without a room. We had 80 kg of luggage with us and trying to find a hotel in Venice in July is hard. I will never book this again and will make sure no one I know does either. Absolutely disgusting treatment .

Reviews.Title: “Great location for visiting Venice”
Reviews.Author: kiawah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night, pre-cruise. In researching Venice and where the ships leave from, it was recommended to get something close to the pier. This hotel was a quick walk from the train terminal (as well as the bus area). We had to cross one bridge and could easily spot the hotel from the train terminal area. The staff was so helpful with tips on what to do and gladly kept our luggage the next morning until we could board the ship. We had a family room with a double bed, roll away cot and couch that could sleep one person. There were lots of places to grab a bit to eat nearby as well as a market to pick up snacks and drinks that was close to the train terminal. I would highly recommend this hotel when visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: Slorg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is visible from Piazzale Roma, a short trip from the cruise pier and was ideal for our post-cruise stay. It was a good value, since it is not in the main tourist areas, but was great for access to the airport busses, which are only one bridge away. The hotel held all of our luggage early in the morning, while took a vaporetto down the grand canal and had a wonderful time in Rialto and San Marco before returning to the Arlecchino. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was standard continental fare, but was good quality. I recommend the Arlecchino for a post-cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: doghouse
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on trip advisor we decided to stay here before and after our cruise. We took the ATVO airport shuttle bus to Piazzale Roma and spotted the hotel immediately, so no wandering around the streets with our luggage looking for our hotel. Our rooms were ready so we were able to relax straightaway. All the staff are very pleasant and helpful. Our room overlooked a canal and with the shutters and window closed slept very well. Mosquito plug ins were available if you wanted to keep the windows open. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and breakfast was good. We would not hesitate to stay here again - its a charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: TWENTY564
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 1 night while in Venice, and it was very nice. Perfect location of the ATVO Bus stop from the airport, and a short walk to the train station the next morning to catch our train to Florence. Would stay here again when we return to Venice. The staff also recommended a nice restaurant (Al Ponte) for us as well.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Venice Hotel - Good location with the Venice feel”
Reviews.Author: DenverTravelHappy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a traditional Venice hotel. I read other reviews about the side entrance but that was not an issue for me. In fact, i'd say it's a none issue. The rooms were very nice and had a Venetian feel to it. They were clean. We requested a full but the "ran out of sheets" and had to split the beds. Although the hotel staff was fine sometimes it seemed like you were bothering them. The hotel is right next to the bus drop off. The breakfast was pretty good. You had to make time arrangments for breakfast which was odd. The breakfast room was small so they could only fit so many people. The location was great. Its a 3 min walk if you get dropped off by bus and about a 10 min walk if you come by train. It is one of the further points to get to St Marco's square but if you take the water bus, it's not bad. The internet worked great in the room. The bathroom was very clean but it didn't have a shower curtain. Not a big deal once you were ok with letting the water fly onto the floor. Overall, I recommend the hotel. It was clean and in a good location. There is a great coffee shop right across the way with good coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Rock-hard beds, but excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: ImaMY
Reviews.Content: The Arlecchino hotel was fairly easy to find, only had to ask once. There is one bridge from P. Roma where the airport bus stops â€“ low wide steps, easy to manage the luggage. Location is convenient for a bus/taxi to the airport, cruise ship, close to vaporetto - only one bridge. Never thought it would be possible to find a hotel room smaller than a cruise ship cabin. The bed was rock hard, I kept thinking of people with bad backs â€“ how they sleep on hard surfaces on doctorsâ€™ orders. The water pressure in the shower was great, meaning water on the floor after shower; there was no shower curtain of course. No shampoo provided, one shower cap, 2 shower gels not replaced in 3 days. The view was nice, on one of the side canals, bridge, and what not. The room and the whole hotel were very clean. Not all floors are accessible by lift. I saw people walking up, and even a couple carrying a stroller probably to the 1st floor (that is above the ground floor, equivalent of floor 2 in the US). The breakfast was so good, I would stay there again just for it! Breads and pastries on the tables with white table cloth, coffee in individual small white coffee pots is brought to the table, everything else is buffet style â€“ cheese, cold cuts, eggs, cereal, fruit, yogurt, juices. There are 2 restaurants on both sides of the hotel with outside seating, we ate at both, no complains, each has a menu in English and other languages.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kirst1971
Reviews.Content: Returned back from a 3 day stay at this hotel and what can I say, I couldnt have wished for anything more. The hotel is litrerally two bridges away from the bus station, so there was none of the 'lugging of cases' around venice, up and down bridges to contend with. We arrived about 1pm and our rooms were ready. We were a party of 6 and two couples were lucky enough to have the canal view. (myself included) The rooms were well decorated and very clean. The usual shampoos,soap etc to assist your stay in the bathroom, If I had to really dig deep and find something to complain about, it would be that there was no shower curtain over the bath, so you did get a bit of a wet floor, but this is only a very minor moan... The breakfast was continental and the staff on hand were very courtiess and friendly. The breakfast room was a quaint little room, and we did have to book a time for breakfast but we were never waiting for a table. The reception staff couldnt have been more helpful. They were happy to help with any queries, reservations etc... This hotel is situated on the outskirts of Venice, which was perfect for us. It is about 30mins walk to the St Marks square, but to walk throught the small alleyways and over the bridges were part of the adventure of getting around. We did see alot this way. The hotel is only a stones throw away from the local waterbus which we purchased a 2 day ticket and just jumped on and off when we needed to. I guess its only like us using the tubes in the UK. Very simple to use, and a great way of seeing the sights from the water. This was my first time in Venice, was I dissapointed - absolutely not, will I be back - absolutely, and if I have my way, I will be staying at this hotel again. I wouldnt look anywhere else - simply perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Easy access direct from bus station, clean comfortable rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Alison190813
Reviews.Content: Across Canal Bridge and turn right down the steps and you are outside Arlecchino Hotel, warm welcome awaited, helpful courteous staff. Dining Room small but continental breakfast very adequate. Water Taxis and Gondolas outside the hotel. Canal side restaurants with dinning inside and out within easy walking distance but dont forget your "Mozzie" spray. Hotel Arlecchino comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Manchestertwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Arlecchio in early May, and found the hoel to be just what we wanted - clean, comfortable and in the perfect spot for when you arrive in Venice. Location - The hotel is just over the bridge from the bus terminal, but once checked in you wouldn't know it (no noise and our views were of the canals)), but this really helps when you have just arrived or are leaving after a short stay, and we saw lots of people struggling with cases in the centre of Venice looking for their hotels. It is a 30 minute walk from the hotel throuigh the alleyways of Venice to St Marks, but this is great as most of the fun of Venice is wandering the streets and bridges, but if walking is not your thing, then the Vaporetto (Water Bus) stop is next to the bus terminus. Hotel & Staff - The guys on reception are extremely helpful, and gave us hints on how to get out to the other islands (Murano & Burano are a must), and how to find the places we wanted to see, and the best tip from the reception manager was "Get Lost in Venice as it one big Museum!". Our room was very traditional, but extremely comfortable and spotlessly clean, and the breakfast waitresses are always welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Pre & Post Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: dstorm6196
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its convenience to the bus and train terminals...over one bridge and we were there. The rooms were adequate and breakfast was enough to get our day started. The A/C unit in our post cruise room did not cool the room but we got a great cross breeze with the windows open. We had a great recommendation for Al Ponte restaurant which was very close by. This hotel is not close to St. Mark's Square (~35 minutes) but our walk provided great exercise and an excellent way to parts of Venice not accessible by boat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on grand canal, out of main tourist area.”
Reviews.Author: vcampisi
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and fantastic gentleman on front desk - really helpful and friendly. Room was clean and spacious for Venice, we were impressed by size. Older decor but still very comfortable and would recommend for a couple of nights stay. Breakfast was substantial.

Reviews.Title: “CANNOT FAULT THE ARLECCHINO!”
Reviews.Author: amculter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 days at the end of March. It was everything we expected it to be from reading reviews - excellent location (especially if arriving on the No 5 bus from airport) The Hotel in general and our very comfortable (without canal view) room was exceptionally clean with fresh towels daily. Breakfast was very adequate with something everyone could enjoy and if you were lucky enough to get a window table overlooking the canal, what better way to start your day.! The Reception Staff were very helpful and efficient and spoke very good English, especially Roberto who was very informative on local history. The Chambermaids and Breakfast Staff were extremely polite and friendly also. We are already planning a return trip next year at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Location-location :D”
Reviews.Author: Tojgli
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only 3 nights to see Venice on a low budget "holiday"! So the hotel was picked by price and location, and it was a good choice! It is rignt next ro piazzala Roma, so if you arrive there, and you like to walk a lot, than its a perfect place to visit Venice! The room we got (standard room) was the smallest i ever seen, but also it is perfect if you are in the hotel only to sleep! The bathroom was even smaller, no chance for 2 to be there together... :D Breakfast, service, cleanliness is ok comparing to the price and stars of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “HIghly reccomended”
Reviews.Author: flynowfla
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights recently. Hotel very well situated for everthing. It is an easy walk from the station (although if you have a lot of bags or can't manage bags up steps you can easily hop on the water bus and go one stop to Piazza Roma). The staff were great and helpful, it is very clean and comfortable, great breakfast and near to everything. Easy from the airport either by water taxi (virtually right to the door) or by water bus - vapporetti, a 5 minute walk. There are many little restaurants and stores nearby and the main sights are an easy walk or bus.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: DaveS707
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and picked it from surfing the web. I was so pleased. The location is fantastic!. Easy to walk all points of venice. Close to all means of transportation, buses, trains and airport. I arrived by train and walked from the train station to the hotel in under 5 minutes. Flew out after taking a bus next to the hotel to the airport. The staff and food was great! I gave it a four out of five on cleanliness only because I don't believe in giving anyone a perfect score. If I go back, I will stay here by all means!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure is open before you go”
Reviews.Author: sahara1276
Reviews.Content: So I rated this hotel very low but I didn't even get to stay at this place because we got there and the water wasn't working. So we got there the hotel was closed and had a sign on the door that said please go to the next door. For our big and great surprise we ended up at the BEST WESTERN hotel right next door. Both hotels are literally a bridge away from the train station. The Best Western was absolutely awsome... The room was very spacious and clean as well as the bathroom. Everything was very well decorated so for the little time we were at the room we felt like we were at a 5 stars super elegant hotel. The only thing is that even though the mattress was quite comfortable the pillows on the other hand were like a rock... so bad that after our first night,the next day we were walking and commenting the horrible pain we had in our ears.. our ear loop was so sore that it felt like we had slept on the floor.. We had brought 2 traveling pillows with us and that helped us for the rest of the time we stayed at this hotel. Breakfast was very good.. food very fresh and super clean and great service.. You should consider the Best Western hotel, although the price difference between that one and the Arlecchino is almost $200 more a night at the Western,but it's worth it. We were lucky though cause we ended up paying the price of the Arlecchino at the Western so...yeap VERY LUCKY...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff, but hotel needs to be updated.”
Reviews.Author: Shampagne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Arlecchino from July 11 - 13, 2010. When we checked in, we were assigned to a tiny room on the top floor that could barely fit a double bed, let alone our luggage. The air conditioning was not working properly. On the plus side, this room had a balcony and an excellent view! The staff was very apologetic that there was not another room available that night, but the next day, they moved our luggage to a larger room, while we were out sightseeing. The second room was more comfortable, with a much larger bathroom, and working air conditioning--which is a necessity when you're in Venice in July! The hotel was close to the main train station, which is great if you are travelling between cities, like we were. It's also close to the Vaperetto (water bus) stop. We took the Vaperetto all the way to St. Mark's Square to enjoy the scenery, then walked back. It's really not a bad walk, even all the way from St. Mark's. Overall, I think the hotel could use some updates, but I gave it decent ratings because the staff was very friendly and accommodating and made every effort to put us in a more comfortable room. I gave the hotel an average rating because of the condition of our first room, which was terrible or poor (except for the view). Had we stayed in our second room from the outset, I would have given this hotel a "very good" rating.

Reviews.Title: “One small bridge and you're there...great location”
Reviews.Author: myoshi
Reviews.Content: They are located in a great location to avoid all the hassle of pulling your wheeled luggage across the cobblestone street and up and down bridges. We were treated very well by all of the helpful staff. And you avoid the high pedestrian traffic streets near the Rialto Bridge and St. Marks Square.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: siciliangirl89
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice, and staff is friendly and helpful. We stayed two nights. The breakfast was good and the waiter was very nice. Beautifully decorated and location is great. We got a room right on the canal, very pretty and spacious. Our water taxi was able to take us from the airport and drop us off right by the hotel. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JackMcDonald
Reviews.Content: We made reservations at the Best Western Hotel Olimpia, three doors down from Hotel Ariecchino. It seem these are 'sister' hotels and we were given rooms at Hotel Ariecchino. We couldn't have been more pleased. The rooms are big (the porter told us larger than at original hotel), extremely clean, well furnished,with comfortable beds and a great view on the canal. The breakfast (included) is exceptional and served in a breakfast room with a waitstaff. It included sweet rolls, yogurt, cereals, fruit, hard boiled eggs and terrific coffee. I can't think of a more convenient for a traveller to Venice. The location is across a canal from Piazzale Roma the main transportation point entering Venice. A word of caution to elderly or travelers with issues handling luggage, the bridge over the canal requires going up and down stairs with your luggage. We were staying in Venice for a few days after disembarking from a cruise ship. If you are planning the same thing here are a few tips: If your destination is Piazzale Roma(the furthest motor vehicles can go) or any hotel near there, you do not need to purchase a 'transfer' from the cruise ship. There is a new 'people mover' tram from the Marittima cruise terminal to Piazzale Roma that costs 1 euro. The walk to the 'people mover' at the head of the pier is level and there is an elevator available. There are two different public bus lines available for transportation to the airport they cost 3.00 euro and start around 5:00 am. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: hearty100
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights with my 2 grown up daughters Service/friendliness was excellent, nothing too much trouble room had a canal view, was very clean and comfortable with great bathroom breakfast was plentiful, tasty and served by a very pleasant waiter, dining room was very small but was impeccably decorated Great location within 2 mins of bus station, vaperetto , restaurants and the grand canal would have no hesitation recommending

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location....with an exceptional front lobby staff”
Reviews.Author: dlb43
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Arlecchino exceeded our expectations in service and value. After reading several reviews, we booked this hotel to follow our cruise from Athens and were so pleased with its location for sightseeing and easy access to the airport and ports. The friendly service-oriented front lobby staff were a delight and our special thank you to Serena. Without hesitation, we would return to this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: oldprune
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here post-cruise. The location can't be any better - just one bridge to cross to Bus terminal, one more to Train Station. We were totally unhappy with the last hotel - Alloggi Agli Artesti Hotel ( big mistake - not for older people), so we can't be happier with this. The staff were very helpful, the suggested restaurant was very good - just down the road, menu changes accouding to "the catch of the day". Free Wi-fi, clean big bathroom with tub, wonderul breakfast with friendly staff. The hotel has small elevator - I wish the room was available pre-cruise! This is our third time in Venice, and first hotel we feel our money was worth spent!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous39
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the night before we left for a cruise. The location of this hotel is perfect and it couldn't be easier to find. There are lots of transportation options nearby at the Piazza Roma (we took a bus from the airport for about 5 Eu). We chose this hotel because they were able to accommodate a room for four. We had a double bed, twin bed, and a small fold out bed. The room was a decent size, the beds were not the most comfortable but they weren't the worst I had found in venice last week. It's about a twenty minute walk to St Marks square and it's an enjoyable walk. The breakfast was very nice, we got there early and got a table right away but there was a small line at the door as we were leaving. Overall, I would say that this is a good hotel and I think it would be my first choice if I ever get to go back to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: mimjoNorthampton
Reviews.Content: As previously said by many, this hotel is excellently situated, right next to bus station, train station, and vaparetto stops. Until you see people pulling and dragging their luggage over many, many bridges (even one is enough) then you do not realise the need to stay as near to stations as possible (of course if you are getting a water taxi from airport straight to your hotel then you are okay - just check first!) Despite proximity to stations there was very little noise at night. We knew this because we had to leave our windows open all night as air-con not working and we were on top floor, so very hot! Even in October. This was not really much of an issue - it would have been had it been noisy or mossie infested (only got a few bites and we had not used sprays etc so what do you expect?) Rooms clean, well laid out (apart from our bathroom) so unless you like very very small bathrooms avoid the top floor room 907! 906 next door had lovely bigger bathroom, so we were just unlucky. They offered to move us the next morning but by that time we had unpacked so just enjoyed the 'quirkyness' of it all.... Small breakfast room, may have to queue for a few minutes later in the morning, but once in good food, lots of it, and the strongest coffee I have ever had - useful after some late nights on the pino grigio! Overall the service was excellent - very friendly, helpful, remembered our room numbers (and we had 3 or 4 different staff who did this) so overall I would recommend as very good value when we booked, excellent location, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rondi3
Reviews.Content: The Arlecchino is very near Piazzale Roma, where buses from the mainland drop visitors off, and where you can stop to unload your car before parking it. The staff are all helpful and friendly. Reception staff speak several languages, and they know their city perfectly. They can offer any advice you need. The room was very well furnished and decorated in period style. We had a upper floor room, with a great view of a main canal.

Reviews.Title: “Not so impressed”
Reviews.Author: Ehaslam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after our cruise because we could get a triple and it is close to P. Roma. The location did work out well but I wasn't overly impressed with the hotel. When we got there, the tiny lobby was so jammed with luggage you had to wait outside for someone to leave before checking in. No shower, just a tub. Other family members stayed at Al Sole which is perhaps a block farther from P Roma. It was cheaper and had a much more inviting lobby area. I'll try that if I get back to Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Teukchul
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Arlecchino for four nights and thought it was wonderful. The hotel was clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated, and the staff were very friendly and helpful when asked for directions/advice on our stay. The Arlecchino is situated near the bus station making it very easy to get to from the airport (a 3 euro bus ride from Marco Polo that takes about 20 mins) and very handy for water buses. It's perfectly situated far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Venice's gift-shop-laden alleyways, but close enough to take a leisurely walk through Venice's many districts, If you don't fancy venturing into the centre of Venice for your evening meal (because sometimes what should take 10 minutes to walk, can often take 30 due to Venice's confusing alleyways!), there are a nice selection of restaurants nearby. Overall it was a wonderful holiday, and I would recommend the Arlecchino to any friend or family who were planning on visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money...”
Reviews.Author: TheExplorerLondon
Reviews.Content: Location: Convenient location. About a couple of minutes walk away from - the Piazzale Roma boat stop and the bus station (to get direct buses to the Marco Polo airport). The main train station itself is only a 10 minute walk at max. from the hotel. Located in a nice neighbourhood. Rooms: Neat and clean. Modern. Could have perhaps been a bit more spacious, but no complaints. Staff: Friendly and helpful. Breakfast: Good spread. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat in Venice”
Reviews.Author: geetar_geek
Reviews.Content: First, the location cannot be beat. If you are arriving in Venice by land (train, bus, taxi from Marco Polo, etc), Arlecchino is located right around the corner from Ferrovia and Piazzle Roma. We saw so many people wandering the streets of Venice with their luggage and it was nice to have to cross only two bridges with our bags. Check-in was a breeze, our room was very clean, had a view of one of the smaller canals like we'd requested and was very comfortable. We immediately craved the pizza we could smell from the trattoria outside our open windows. Arlecchino was also very convenient to the P. le Roma waterbus station, gondola station, offered water taxi service to Murano. The evening manager was also able to make excellent dinner recommendations and helped us venture off the Grand Canal and explore Venice more deeply.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for pre or post cruise”
Reviews.Author: Co-tim
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on location near the bus terminal. It is an easy walk to the shuttle stops for the cruise lines and the airport shuttle bus. The breakfast was very good, service was also good. It was expensive (as is all of Venice in the summer), and the rooms are nothing fancy, but they were very clean and comfortable. There are numerous restaurants nearby which are good, and without some of crowds along the Grand Canal or Plaza San Marco. After a day of sightseeing and crowds, it is nice to find quieter places for a casual dinner with kids. Highly recommend if you are going on a cruise from Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel517
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Ryanair at Treviso airport. The ATVO bus was waiting outside and we bought 'returns' for 9 euros each. The journey took about an hour to Piazzole de Roma. We got out , looked across the square and there was the hotel - couldn't have been more convenient. Even though it is close to this busy, busy terminal ( buses, boats and trains ) it does not spoil the charm of the hotel and certainly there is little noise. In the mornings you can hear the boatmen going about their business but for us it wasn' t a problem. The reception staff couldn't be more helpful, gave us maps, told us about the vaporettos to St. Marks and recommended nearby restaurants. Our room was 804 on a corner with views in all directions. It was small but perfectly adequate and spotlessly clean. ( Mini bar, TV, telephone and hairdrier ). Breakfast was continental but quite a large choice, meats, cheese, cereal, croissants, yoghurt and fruit. Be warned if you are there on a Sunday you might have to queue for a table as its a small dining room. The location is right on a canal and there are lovely strolls all around the area. The Grand Canal starts about 200 metres away. Also the vaporetto stop is very close by and you can go to St. Marks via the Grand Canal or via Canal Guidecca. Either way takes about 30 mins but it is a fascinating trip. Do walk from the hotel towards St. Marks following the handy signs on the walls. You will see the real Venice, many delightful squares , bridges and canals. Lastly be warned that many restaurants hit you with a cover charge and service plus a tip on top!! Check it before you sit down. We ate 2 nights at Ostaria Venexiana, really close to the hotel and suggested by them. Antonella was delightful, gave us a welcome aperitivo, couldn't be more helpful and no cover or service. Venice is expensive but its really worth it and the hotel Arlecchino is a great base to start from.

Reviews.Title: “great location for pre cruise but hotel a bit of a let down for the price”
Reviews.Author: mpjGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one day before a fantastic cruise trip.If you want no hassle with transfers this area is the place to choose but maybe not this hotel.A 3 euro bus ride takes you here in 15 mins from Marco polo airport(bus stop right at airport exit door and buy ticket at machine).The hotel was almost across the road from where the bus stops at Piazzale Roma and you can see it from there.The reception was tiny and crowded with suitcases and you were not made to feel very welcome.The room was small but o.k(2 adults and a 10 year old )but for 270euros i maybe expected a bit more.I think the location near the cruise liners dictates the price.The hotel breakfasts was in a confined joint room on the first floor and was very average.The free cruise buses (100yards away)to take you to your ship really do make life easy, because Venice in all its glory , was not designed for carrying luggage over long distances.Overall if you just want a convenient location for a pre -cruise, this area is great but the real Venice charm is located down by the Rialto area.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing stay in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Clarke2010
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel on Wednesday 30th June 2010. When booking the hotel, I requested a room for two adults and three children. I also requested a room with canal views and rang the hotel to ensure they received my request. It seems that these requests were ignored and we were given a room in the attic with no windows except for a skylight that had to remain closed due to the heat. In other words, far from having canal views, our room had no windows or view at all. In addition to this disappointment, it was not possible for my family to shower, given the slope of the ceiling in the bathroom was so low. Finally, given there was no lift access to the attic, my children and I had to carry our luggage down the steep stairs. After voicing our complaints to the staff, we were told that this was the only room available for a family of five. If they were honest to begin with and had informed us, we would have chosen alternative accommodation. Relative to other hotels this was not cheap accommodation and we expected more from our stay, especially given your association with the Best Western chain. Unfortunately the stay in this hotel, soured our stay in Venice. I would advise this hotel not to deceive other families in future as this holiday was something most families (including ours) save and plan for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at hotel Arlecchino”
Reviews.Author: boysau
Reviews.Content: Location....location...location.... in a city like Venice where you have to walk over bridges with suitcases, it's a big advantage to have the hotel near by the bus stop Pl Roma. You see the hotel from bus stop. You take the ATVO from airport to plaza l.Roma for 3euro per person. The service is great, as the staff is there to help you and they are very friendly. The room are quite big for Europe and even for Venice. The beds are confortable and the bathroom is modern and clean. We took a room not on the canal so there was no noise......quiet enough so we could sleep well.....we also book 4 months in advance and saved 30%... As were taking a cruise, we were told by the staff that there is a free shuttle to cruise We recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm....”
Reviews.Author: goldseashell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at thus hotel one night pre cruise trip and are we ever glad we did! When the airport bus stopped at Piazelle Roma and we got out with hundreds of other bewildered travellers the hotel was right in our view. We almost cheered because it was such a short walk over the bridges. The hotel is charming, shabby chic and very cozy. The canal room was worth the extra cost to sit and watch the boats and people go about their business. Room 808 was quite comfortable and had everything we needed. The wifi worked very well from our room. Breakfast was plentiful and fresh and the room was busy but we did not have to wait or feel rushed. All the staff were helpful and kind and give us lots of information. There are lots of cafes and restaurants nearby. It is just fun to stroll around Venice eating gelato and seeing the sights. Loved the hotel and it's location for that!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return...”
Reviews.Author: Nessacery
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Arlecchino in November of 2007 (Tripadvisor will only allow to backdate 1 year?) with a group of 5 friends in addition to myself. Our rooms consisted of: 1 double (married couple) 1 single (friend who is a LIGHT sleeper and can't comfortably share a room with anyone who snores) 1 triple We arrived at the hotel and was able to find it SO easily - just across a canal from the Piazzale Roma, we were able to walk there in less than 5 minutes where we were greeted by Marco. The location has its plusses and minuses. The plus is that it is so close and easily accessible to the Piazzale Roma. The minus is that it can be quite a walk to the sights. However, those walks are beautiful. Venice at night is breathtaking. I do not understand the reviews stating that Marco was unfriendly in any way. The days we were there, Marco was very helpful in giving directions, advice on things to do, and just friendly in general: chatting with us when we would come back to the hotel in the evenings, asking what we had done that day, how we'd enjoyed everything - he was sincerely friendly, welcoming, and very hospitable. The rooms were nice - nothing fancy, but nothing horrible either. The only suggestion I would make would be for them to put up shower curtains in the bathrooms - the lack of a shower in a little odd. Breakfast was adequate for a free breakfast, but nothing outstanding (except the coffee - the coffee was delicious) - breads, pastries, fantastic coffee. Across an alley from the hotel is a cafe/wine bar. One of my favorite parts of each evening was to get a bottle of wine to share with friends and sit along the canal. I've just recently booked another package trip to Italy for this November and when given the choices for hotels I chose to return to Hotel Arlecchino. I'm looking forward to seeing the city again, wandering through the alleyways to find the best hidden restaurants, going to that wine bar (can't remember the name of it!), and seeing Marco again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamie022
Reviews.Content: First, they didn't have our reservation when we got there, but they did give us a room anyway. The room was tiny, about 1 foot of space on each side of bed and that was it. And to use our private bathroom, you had to go out in the hallway to another door. The bathroom was long and narrow, you could barely get between the sink and toilet. Air conditioning was useless, so hot.

Reviews.Title: “Narrow, cramped and smallest rooms in Arlecchino like streets in Venise.”
Reviews.Author: d4etver
Reviews.Content: We had 2 double room in that hotel. They were TOO SMALL for the price we have payed. It is our 6 time in Venice and we didn't have such terrible and narrow rooms. It's a SHAME for BEST WESTERN HOTEL CHAIN to have such cramped and smallest rooms. Last year we chose Albergo San Zulian (3*) and enjoyed it. it's a pity that this time we chose Arlecchino. No cloak room, smallest and narrow lobby with reception. We wanted to leave our laggage in a cliak room, but the receptionist suggested us leaving it right in the lobby, practically in the street, without smb's supervision!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but convenient”
Reviews.Author: JoanneV095
Reviews.Content: Everyone is right, rooms are very small, but decorated nicely. Bed could use a new mattress as it sagged in the middle. We overlooked the canal and you needed to close your window because it was very noisy (we were on the 2nd floor), so you needed to keep the air conditioning on to drown out the noise of the outside. But very convenient. We stayed 2 nights to catch a cruise ship on the Saturday, and the front desk manager informed us there is a free shuttle that takes us to the port. We didn't know that and are very grateful for his knowledge. It's right off the bus stop (very, very convenient), so you didn't need to carry your luggage far - it's pretty hard with all the stairs they have in Venice. You could walk to St. Marc's in 30 minutes. Breakfast was pretty good both days, but crowded if you didn't get there early enough. All in all, I would recommend this hotel if you are only staying for a one night (if you are taking a cruise), but no longer. With the room we had being so small, we would have felt confined.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: LEOFRICK
Reviews.Content: We stayed just for one night after a cruise. The hotel is extremely convenient, situated as it is right next to the major transport hub at Piazalle Roma. The man on reception was very friendly and even arranged a water taxi over to Murano for us, so that we could visit a glass factory. The rooms are small but comfortable. We had a canal-view room, which was actually fairly quiet when the windows were closed, and we had no noise problems. Breakfast was pleasant and plentiful. A great little hotel in a great location for the traveller who is just passing through. Great little coffee bar right opposite the entrance to the hotel. Their hot chocolate is delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service saved this place”
Reviews.Author: BillMcK
Reviews.Content: A quick walk to the hotel prevents carrying luggage throughout Venice. The room was in a corner and very small but in all honesty we weren't there that much. The people at the hotel were great and made us feel at home for our first day. The free wifi didn't hit our room and we were told wifi was inconsistent but we found that if you we standing next to the elevator on the second floor it worked great for our calls home using Skype.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ehogan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Arlecchino for one night after our plane trip and three nights two weeks later before our cruise. Perfect location for us - the bus from the airport dropped us off at Piazzale Roma and we could see the hotel from there - a comfort to have a two minute walk to the hotel at 11 p.m.! Staff were always very pleasant and helpful. The room was small but had a lovely view of the canal and was kept immaculately clean. We enjoyed the excellent breakfast included in the price of the hotel. Except for one vaporetto ride along the Grand Canal, we walked everywhere from our hotel and thoroughly enjoyed getting lost on occasion. A hint - always look for the yellow signs on the buildings directing you to either San Marco or the train station. When we return to Venice, we will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The essence of Venice”
Reviews.Author: DaveDPerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: Dragging suitcases over Canal bridges ,up narrow stairs, into a room smaller than your bathroom at home - before you decide to turn around and go home - open the window and look down the canal filled with Gondolas and locals walking ,eating ,living , it becomes a palace - this will live in our memories for ever .Great hotel - character -great staff - good friendly people - magic location - Thanks Francesco for the unforgettable experience

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: MandS39
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Easter week. 2 minutes walk from Piazzale Roma (busses), train station, vaporetta stop and no more than 30 minutes walk to St Mark's square (once you get used to all the turns - but that's the beauty of Venice, isn't it?). Paid a bit extra for a canal view but it was well worth it. Hotel staff were excellent in every way - special mention to Roberto (Bob, that's a great Welsh accent). We'll be back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value so clean and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: MariaHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay , our room was fairly small but immaculate . great location for walking Venice . The bus station was two mins walk but to be honest once in the hotel you don't realise how close you are to it . The staff very helpful and friendly .Asked if possible to get a hot drink at night , a pot of tea was sent to our room and we were only charged 2 euros !!! One word of warning we were offered a taxi ride to Munrano for 5 Euro each , but this is a FREE service paid for by the glass factory .Just ask at reception to book your FREE taxi and get the waterbus back 6.50 Euro each . Lovely breakfast room , good buffett breakfast . Would certainly return !!

Reviews.Title: “Caters for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Geogteacher01
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that I've stayed in this hotel and intend that there should be a third and fourth! It is so convenient when you arrive late in the evening, and can't bear the thought of getting lost looking for your hotel. It's straight off the direct airport bus and into the hotel. The one good thing is that you can't really hear the noise from the bus station for some reason. There are working canals from most windows, and you see all sorts. This time I watched a man wash some clothes in the canal! Weird! I also saw a police launch go by with a man in handcuffs ,soaking wet and wrapped in a 'space blanket'. All rooms are colourful, if not a little bijou, but you only sleep and shower there. Breakfast is great and you really can set yourself up for the day. The best recommendation are the staff. Well done guys!! March is a brilliant time to go to my favourite city. Just wish some authority or other would try to do something about the graffitti ,which gets worse every time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot, what more could you wish for!”
Reviews.Author: TailsTonbridge
Reviews.Content: Fantastically placed hotel. Off the Express bus from the airport to Hotel, less than 5 mins, 3 euros each. Although close to the bus station, you would never guess it was. Room 706, great, facing out to the canals and the hustle bustle in the early mornings. Monday morning seemed to be the busiest with lots of boats ferrying goods into Venice but not a problem for a good sleeper. Very large room and huge bed, wonderful. Breakfast was simple but as expected. All the staff very friendly and very helpful, they organised a private boat for us to Murano for 5 euros each. Taxi back was 6.50 with everyone else. March is definately the time to go, prices are good and people less. We were offered discounts on glass! The hotel is in the best area for eating, as prices are lower then if you walk in towards St Marks Square. We booked the hotel and flight seperate, Easyjet Â£60 each return and the hotel was Â£80 each, including breakfast for 3 nights, so Â£140 total each.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and I'm a fussy American”
Reviews.Author: 2retiredpeople
Reviews.Content: 2 minutes from bus and train station, right on the canal, just remodeled, fantastic/rich looking rooms and bathroom, cleaned daily, spotless, great continental breakfast, wonderful staff, right near restaurants, shops, grocery store, water bus stop- so unique and charming, right near everything

Reviews.Title: “Getting lost in venice is easy - but thats the fun of it!”
Reviews.Author: Cretancouple
Reviews.Content: A small hotel, well placed right on the canals. 30 minutes walk from St Marks, its makes for a lovely stroll into the centre of Venice, where no route will be the same. Forget your maps and take pot luck with the alleys and bridges. Watch your feet though, as there seems to be a lot of dog owners in Venice, but remember to keep an eye out for the yellow signs pointing you in the right direction if you do get lost. Our traditionally decorated room was small but cosy and immaculately clean and gave us the comforts of a shower and small bath, pipeing hot water, and a comfortable bed to dive into at the end of the day. Breakfast is served buffet style in a lovely bright room overlooking the canal, where there is so much on offer you can fill up for a late lunch. All the staff are very friendly and are always on hand to assist. We found that 3 days here was just long enough to see all the important sights and gave us a chance to sample some of the delicious local fare. You cant go wrong with Osteria - La patatina ....somewhere enroute to the rialto bridge....go on be brave..and get lost in Venice and discover the best of it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: P0ppets
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July whilst doing a bit of travelling around Italy with my boyfriend. We got a bus from the airport and pretty much saw the hotel after getting of the bus which was a relief as Venice is a bit of a maze! It was a bit far away from St Marks Square, but the best thing about Venice is you can just walk down all the different alleys and you'll never take the same route twice!! The aircon wasn't very good so it got a bit hot at points, but not a bit problem for us. All in all I'm glad we chose this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Venitian gem”
Reviews.Author: Moondog1948
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice on Nov. 5th, 2009. We got our luggage and proceeded to the Blue buses heading for Piazzale Roma the only bus stop in Venice. When we got off the bus we could see the hotel. It did require lugging suitcases up and down a few flight of stairs but totally manageable and we are senior's. As we are accustomed to in Venice the rooms were small. We did have a beautiful canal view and the rooms were decorated quite nicely. Clean, clean, clean. The bathroom was spotless. Marco at the front desk could not have been more helpful. He had maps and gave directions as well as suggestions for sightseeing around Venice. The breakfast was wonderful and the coffee, freshly brewed , was outstanding. We chose to walk and it took about 30 minutes to get to St. Marks Square via the Rialto Bridge. There is a Vaporetto (water taxi) stop a few blocks from the hotel. next trip to Venice we will surely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, near transporation hub, great front desk service”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Cruise2
Reviews.Content: We (friend and I) stayed at this hotel just one night, after disembarking from a cruise ship. The location is near Piazzale Roma, which is a transportation (bus, taxi) hub, and an easy 45-minute walk to St. Mark's Square. A wonderful walk, good signage, hundreds of shops and restaurants along the way. Tiny lobby, which is think is typical. Front desk was great in assisting with airline online check-in and printing of boarding pass. Room was standard. Bath was odd in that there was no shower curtain. I hugged the wall during my short shower, and still got lots of water on the floor. The hotel is short walk from P Roma, but involves a bridge and a fair amount of stairs. Problematic when schlepping luggage, even wheeled bags. I understand they have breakfast, included, but we left for the airport before it was available. If anybody tells you that P Roma is a short, easy walk from the cruise ship terminal, don't believe a word of it. It was raining, so we took a cab, and I'm so glad we did. Perhaps there is an easier/shorter route if you're walking, but it's still some distance away (more than a mile). I can't imagine doing that while toting luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Got better and better”
Reviews.Author: NorCalSkyy
Reviews.Content: When I first saw the room, I did not like it due to the peeling wallpaper....but as I spent a few days, it grew on me. It was quaint. It wasn't THAT small, quite roomy for Venice! It was quiet. We got a corner room and could stick our head out and see a view of the canal! yes. The bathroom was clean and lots of hot water and new tub. Sheets were clean. Fridge actually was one of the more cold ones that we got during our European vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service In Venice”
Reviews.Author: gile
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my two daughters and wife, for a special occasion. We stayed in room 905. The location of the hotel was perfect, however, unfortunately our stay was ruined by the extremely poor customer service. On the first day our toilet wouldn't flush, we therefore reported it to the receptionist Marco, who was extremely rude and unhelpful. Eventually they sent a junior luggage porter to investigate this, where he told us to leave the room so someone could come and fix it. However, the toilet still didn't work and we weren't given an explanation as to why or advice on what we could do. We ended up using local bar toilets during the entire stay as our one was never fixed. On our first morning, when we entered the breakfast room, there was a young waitress who didn't greet us, let alone explain the breakfast self service. Staff at this hotel need urgent training on the basic customer services.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: tcardona
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Arlecchino for one night prior to our cruise. The location was excellent!
