Literally got off the bus from the airport at Piazalle Roma, walked over one small bridge with our suitcases, and we were there. The location was actually quite quiet. Very close to the vaporetto stop, great starting point for exploring, and very close to the ports for cruises(ten minute walk). The staff was very friendly and helpful, breakfast and the breakfast room were lovely. Our room overlooked a canal and had a small veranda. Room decorated in old world style, bathroom clean and efficient. No spa or room service-but who wants to hang around the hotel with Venice at your door to explore!! We ate dinner at a small cafe overlooking the next small canal, which was very good and not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “One hundred percent for convenience”
Reviews.Author: PeregrineFife
Reviews.Content: So easy to find - literally visble as the bus from the airport pulls into the bus depot. Feared this would be a mistake and noisy or crowded but this was not the case - the hotel sits on a canal bank and is very quiet after the day trippers have gone home. Minutes from a vaporetto stop at the start of the Grand Canal to explore the rest of the city, and minutes on foot to quiet campos for coffee and eating out. The staff spoke good English and were very helpful. The room was clean and comfortable with good air-con. The breakfasts were basic Continental fare but perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Before-After Cruise hotel best for to-from Airport-hotel”
Reviews.Author: JP-UK-US
Reviews.Content: If you want the most convenient hotel to stay at before or after you cruise, or just a hotel that offers to cheapest and shortest commute to and from Marco-Polo Airport to Venice, the Arlecchino is your place. All buses ride up to Piazzale Roma only and the Arlecchino can be seen from the bus station, just a short walk over the bridge. It is only 3 EUR one way per person via ATVO, the bus that brings you and your luggage to Venice from the airport. The Vaporetto (public boat) stop is right there as well if you want to access all major points in Venice or you can just walk at your leisure all the way to Piazza San Marco or Academia. Our room was better than expected with a pleasant decor and spacious enough for a building in Venice. It even has a lift, though small it saves you the trip all the way up with your luggage. The staff will even offer to take your bags upstairs for you. One thing that I liked the most about this small hotel was the staff and the convenience of its location. My husband forgot a few items in the room we stayed at on the night before our cruise and we were able to recover this shortly before taking our bus to the airport after arriving from our cruise. The port where the cruise boat docked was just a 10 - 15 min walk or if your cruise offers it, a shuttle ride to Piazzale Roma brings you right back to the hotel in no time. The breakfast was better than expected (again, for a small 3 star hotel) it had quality rather than quantity. Plenty of cold cuts, pastries, bread, cereals offered in a bright pleasant room. Two things though that you might consider. There is no shower curtain in the bathroom, so you might need to be careful if you are the one to splash around and if you choose a canal view, you have to know that the motor boats will probably wake you up in the morning, but if you are to get up to see Venice anyways, it might just suit your needs. Great value overall, my husband and I are just so happy we stayed here before our cruise because it was very convenient and the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LoveItalia09
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel, it was beyond our expectation. Our room over looked a canal and was spacious. Our room was very clean and very comfortable. I loved having the lift. The staff were accommodating and gave us many suggestions on where to eat and where to find wine and other items. Once we figured out how to shower without getting the bathroom soaking wet (we showered each other) all was fantastic. Close to train station and Piazza Roma, where we caught the vaporetto to tour the Grand Canal. We loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rotten egg”
Reviews.Author: Cruiser61
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 days at Hotel Arlecchino prior to boarding our cruise ship. The hotel is a 3 star, located a very short walk to the bus terminal. The room we were allocated on the 2nd floor was tiny with a view along a small canal overlooking some cafes and the other window looking out towards the bus terminal. It was so cramped that one of us had to sit on the bed to let the other pass! The bathroom was passable, however there was no shower curtain and no extractor fan. The lift was very cramped and accommodated 1 person and luggage. Breakfast was continental and a total disappointment - my husband is a coeliac and there were only bread rolls, pastries or biscuits on offer, some of them stale. My husband had a boiled egg each morning as there were no hot breakfasts and on the last morning his egg was rotten! The smell lingered for days. The coffee was great, strong and aromatic, however the cutlery was badly chipped. The staff were helpful and pleasant but not forthcoming. Hope this helps some other travellers when making their decision.

Reviews.Title: “Great location -- and a lift!”
Reviews.Author: SaraOregon
Reviews.Content: After a cruise, we wanted a one-night stay that would make it easy to get to the airport very early the next morning. This hotel is superbly located right at Piazza Roma. You can see the hotel from the plaza and it was a quick walk to the airport bus. It is across a small canal so there are a few steps up and down. It's quite easy to get other places in Venice either by walking or by water bus. The elevator was a welcome surprise! Our room was spacious with a bathroom ensuite. There was no shower curtain on the tub/shower and the TV didn't work but everything was clean and neat. We appreciated that there was someone on duty at the front desk 24 hours/day.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, small dining room”
Reviews.Author: penelope057
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here from 16th May 2009 for 1 week. This is a very clean hotel, sheets & towels changed every day. Rooms not terribly big but adequate. A room on the canal side was very noisy with boats chugging past at 4.30 am, some guests too were less than considerate banging doors early in the morning!! The breakfast was continental & enough choice but the dining room held only 9 tables seating only 3 people comfortably which meant queuing some mornings. The staff were very helpful in all respects & could not have been nicer. The Burchielle restaurant ( out of the Hotel & straight forward down the canal side) was very good & not too expensive. Venice has become very dear elsewhere, e.g 6 or 7 euros for a glass of beer & a good reataurant could be 80 -90 euros for starter, main course, water & 1/2 carafe of house wine for two people!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LancashireAnnie
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. We spent 3 nights here. Its in an ideal location near Piazzale Roma, just a short walk from the Airport Bus Stop and also very convenient for the vaporetto stop which will take you to all parts of the city. The room was lovely and clean with big windows overlooking the canal. All the reception staff are very friendly and helpful (especially Mirco) with plenty of advice. I highly recommend this hotel for your break in the beautiful city of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Visit!”
Reviews.Author: Viziata
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and thoroughly enjoyed being in the lesser known side of the canal. The room (coral room featured in ad) was very roomy and comfortable. We enjoyed the canal view and the hustle and bustle going on below us on the sidewalks and canal. Easy access and easily spotted as soon as we stepped off the bus from the airport. The new bridge affords easy access to the other side of the canal but we always prefer walking further down to the next bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and Service”
Reviews.Author: Carol056
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and found the hotel to be very good value compared to other hotels in Venice. We had booked a basic room (Â£74)which was right at the top, very quaint, with a tiny bathroom but perfectly adequate for a weekend and it was very quiet. Breakfast buffet was excellent with plenty of choice, and served in a pleasant room. We found all of the reception staff to be exceptionally helpful and friendly - we were even able to check in to our room early. It is quite a walk to the main sights, but we enjoyed seeing the back canals and bridges as much as the centre. Location of this hotel is really easy to find, you can see it as the bus from the airport pulls in. If I came back to Venice I would stay here again, but. might be tempted to pay a bit more and try the next grade of room. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top Service, Great location, Quaint clean room”
Reviews.Author: MauiBodyboarder
Reviews.Content: We were directed to an adjacent hotel (Best Western Olympia) which is also owned by the same company. It was very nice, excellent breakfast and very friendly service. It is older but in very good condition. We enjoyed the dated theme. It was a short walk from the garage which costs about 22E unless you rent a premium room. You can't get much closer to parking in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Chels
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Venice for 4 nights. We booked a double room for two adults and it was adequate for our needs, albeit a little small. We were told on the second day that we were going to be moved to their sister hotel Olimpia which is next door. This was due to impending refurbishment works. This was slightly irritating as I had not been informed of this on booking and we had to pack our stuff to be moved 10 metres down the road. Hotel Olimpia was very similar to the Arlecchino but without the romantic decor. For some reason there were no shower curtains in either hotel, no needless to say the bathroom got pretty wet! The breakfast was very nice and there was enough selection, with tea and coffee included. The location is about a 30/40 minute walk to St. Marks depending on which route you take, although we did get horribly lost returning to our hotel on the first night! Venice is a lovely city, but the downside is everything is so expensive, especially the food!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrelandOriel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family over christmas break. Come from Bolzano on the train and the old details on the website dont take the new bridge into account, we made inquiries about easiest way to get there, only took 5 minutes walk over the bridge, would have been more hassle had we followed the internet directions given by the hotel. Ok, once we arrived, friendly staff...tiny lift!Bags were brought up for us. We had a family room (1 double, 2 singles) and a double. Family room was great size, double slightly small but perfectly adequate. Decor was nice.Bathrooms were a fine size, although can't understand why they dont have shower curtains...room gets very wet during showering. Breakfast was fine, typical continental, plenty to eat. Good locatoin for rambling into centre, see plenty along the way, only c. 30 mins stroll to st marks. Also really handy for buses to/from airport or trains.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Arlecchino-Venice: Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Blondesteven
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed two nights at the wonderful Hotel Arlecchino in Venice. The hotel, conveniently located adjacent to the bus and train station, is small, comfortable, charming, friendly staff and offers a great breakfast. We had one "double" and one "single" room, both of which were comfortable. The single was a tad small, but offered a great view of the canals. Breakfast was delicious, with freshly brewed coffee, juices, cereals, yogurt, meat, cheese and breads. From the hotel, it's a beautiful 20-40 minute walk to St. Mark's Square (there are two ways to go). We found marvelous Restaurante de Venezziano 1 block from the hotel, and enjoyed a delicious soup and pasta meal (the country vegetable soup was amazing). There is also a beautiful grocery store 2 blocks away, adjacent to the Vaporetta stop. Transfer tip from Venice airport: take the 3 Euro AVTO bus, which departs from the airport and drops you off at the main bus/rail stations in Venice, and especially helpful at this hotel. The Alliliguna can be tough when you have baggage.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay here”
Reviews.Author: DianaEscu
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a great four-night stay at the Arlecchino with my teenage daughter. The location is really convenient - we took the 9:10pm bus from the airport and were in our room just after 9:40. The reception staff were friendly, professional and welcoming, and helpful when I had a problem. Our room wasn't enormous but we found it very clean, comfortable and quiet, as the shutters, double-glazed windows and curtains cut out external noise and indeed light (although our room faced a quiet side street rather than the canal). Occasionally you could hear noise from neighbouring rooms but not so much that it caused a problem even for a light sleeper like me. Although we didn't have a canal view there was a nice view of the building across the way - nothing special, just shuttered windows and window boxes with a few simple plants but I liked it! Each day of our stay we would get back to our room after a day of sightseeing and sit for an hour or so reading and relaxing with the window open in the early evening, absorbing the atmosphere of being in Italy, before going out for dinner and in my case enjoying a nice Prosecco from the minibar. Breakfast (7am to 10:30am) was plentiful and we really enjoyed it - several rolls and a croissant each and you could help yourself to swiss cheese or brie, several types of ham, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, fresh fruit, various cakes, cereals etc. No UK-style breakfast but I wouldn't really want or expect that in Italy. The breakfast staff served tea, coffee, cappuccino etc and were very friendly, remembering what we'd asked for the previous day. We liked the caffe latte best as you could add just the right amount of milk and coffee from separate jugs. The room did get quite full towards 9am on the Saturday morning and a couple had to wait for a table but we had no problem ourselves. We ate well in the Campo Santa Margarita and Dorsodouro - but after getting lost one evening we had a meal in a restaurant by the canal a few minutes along from the hotel and it wasn't good at all, although it was pricey just the same so probably best to give those restaurants a wide berth. On our last morning we strolled out of the hotel at 8:35am with ample time to catch our 8:55 bus for the airport. That was definitely one of my reasons for choosing the Arlecchino as I knew that, on a first visit, I would have spent our stay worrying about the journey home. Although I would like to stay in other parts of Venice in the future I wouldn't hesitate to return to the Arlecchino, especially with an early/late arrival or departure time.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice if transiting between cruise and/or airport”
Reviews.Author: lmg11
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because we were only staying one night after a cruise. For this reason, the location is ideal, because the cruise will drop you off at the Piazzale Roma. The hotel is right there, so easy to roll your bags to it. The next day we rolled the bags back into the Piazzale Roma, and caught the express bus to Marco Polo airport for 3 euro pp. Very easy, and this let us enjoy our day with minimal hassles/expense with luggage. We arrived early, and the room was ready at 9am. Nice, large room with 4 beds and aircon-- comfortable for our family. Easy access to other parts of Venice by walking or water bus. Charming cafes on the canal for lunch or dinner nearby. We actually enjoyed this neighborhood more than the crowded San Marco area, where we stayed before. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, but it is particularly great if you want to maximize the benefits of a quick layover in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Alecchino Hotel - Venice - Just Grand”
Reviews.Author: Tommy_Belfast
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Feb 2008, weather was nice, we flew direct from Belfast with Easyjet, Aiport was clean and tidy, we do not speak italian which did not matter as they spoke good english that you could understand. The hotel was clean so easy to find so handy to everything, Could not fault this hotel in any way the staff were pleasant, place clean, lovely inside, rooms clean large and had lovely wooden shutters that looked out onto the canal, dinning room was bit small but adequate food was good choice and the staff in their friendly. Only down side is we were next door to the maids store and all the laughing and giggling and noise was a bit much. Tv had 1 english channel CNN news, I know you dont go on holiday to watch tv but after crossing all them bridges bit of tv would be nice. Beds were large and roomy bathroom was out of this world, mini bar was expensive so we bought in shop close by. All in all I could not fault this hotel for handyness the decor is lovely staff are lovely would deffo like to go back to this hotel as it was just superb.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect Location and Service!”
Reviews.Author: TravelChica27
Reviews.Content: The service was magnificent! The staff are ALL very friendly and are eager to share favorite spots and directions. One of the gentlemen spoke fluently in five different languages and they all spoke enough English to communicate. One concierge was kind enough to give us extra wake up calls after noticing we were late to catch our bus for the airport! A GREAT advantage of this hotel was the option for room service. For only 5 Euros, you can get the complimentary breakfast sent up to your room! You also have some heavy breakfast options, such as omelets, hard to find in Italy. We were on our honeymoon and it was a great surprise for a tight budget! Another plus, each room is equipped with international outlets meaning you do not need an adapter to use your appliances. The Arlecchino Hotel was in a perfect location! It was a five minutes walk to several Vaporetto stops and is literally steps away from the Piazzala Roma bus stop, perfect for the airport! There is a huge supermarket called COOP, which is close to the vaporetto spot. There you can get a Coca Cola for .50 E and a liter of water for .35 E, saving you over 3 Euros each anywhere else. Especially with the heat in May, this was a GREAT advantage! Also, there is a WONDERFUL restaurant down the side street of the hotel, on the water, the name included the word hostel. The food was the BEST we had in Italy and so was the service. They had a great tourist menu, which is more thant enough for two people. It is on the left hand side of the Gelato (Ice cream) shop that is next to the hotel. The only con of the ARLECCHINO was the smell in the lobby. It smelled like sewage, which could be from the water, however it only smelled like that in the lobby. The lobby is very small and so is the elevator, however these are little things that were uncomfortable. Don't be fooled by the pictures on the website, even though several room are rather large we did not have that luck. Our room was comfortable, however it was very small and there was no small couch (as in all the pictures)! The bathroom size was great and roomy. Overall, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: pringlemonster
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Arlecchino Hotel, Venice, with my mum and sister. All are agreed that this was an excellent choice! Everything was as promised and absolutely no problems to report. The hotel's location is it's biggest asset. We arrived late at night and weren't sure how easy it would be to find, but needn't have worried! I easily saw the hotel from the airport bus as it pulled into Piazzale Roma (ATVO Venezia Express service from Marco Polo Airport, Line 35, 3 Euros). An easy 2 minute walk and we were there. Throughout our stay we were constantly thankful we had chosen this hotel, as it's location made everything so easy. All the water bus (ACTV Vaparetto - 3 day pass was good value and saved a lot of hassle buying tickets) lines stop at P.Roma a few minutes walk from the hotel, and San Marco and Rialto were easily found on foot by following the obvious yellow signs which start just over the bridge from the hotel (visible from the breakfast room). Also, the setting is really pleasant considering the hotel is right next to the bus station - plenty of canals and bridges surround the hotel, and we really enjoyed being able to watch all the boats on the canals whilst having breakfast each morning. And finally, when we left early on our last morning, we were again grateful we had a very short walk with our bags to get the bus back to the airport. The rooms were perhaps a little worn in places, however, they were beautifully clean, with all towels and bed sheets changed every day. We stayed in a triple superior room on the first floor. This had a large double (made of two large single beds) and a large single sleigh-style bed. The breakfast was more than satisfactory, and better than most continental style breakfasts. The breakfast room staff were very friendly and efficient. The room itself was small, but we always managed to get a table, and the views outside were great. Reception staff were invariably friendly and welcoming. We found a good restaurant close to the hotel - Trattoria Rosa (not full name!) which I would happily recommend. Friendly staff and very tasty food. When you leave the hotel, turn right and walk to the footbridges. Ahead, over a canal, you will see the yellow sign directing to San Marco and Rialto. Walk in this direction for a few minutes at most, and you will see the restaurant on the left, over a canal bridge, situated on a street corner. Handy if you want to eat close to the hotel. Would definately recommend this hotel to friends and would stay again. Cleanliness, friendliness and location were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venetian Experience”
Reviews.Author: sweepea58
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed three nights at the Arlecchino and loved everything about it. We experienced warm hospitality and helpful advice from the staff. Our room had a great view of the canal, and we enjoyed the sounds of the canal. The clean bathroom boasted a bathtub! The location is great - near enough the tourist attractions for a nice walk, but far enough to avoid the crowds. The walk to St. Mark's and the Rialto bridge takes you through great neighborhoods. We would recommend the Arlecchino to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, characteristic, tiny room.”
Reviews.Author: ham_green
Reviews.Content: Location: I loved the location especially. About 5 minutes' walk from the train station and Pl. Roma, so it was a mercifully short distance to carry the luggage. Situated next to the canal, of which my room had an excellent view. Also next door to several superb restaurants. About 30 minutes walk to San Marco, and about 20 minutes to Rialto and Accademia bridges. Staff: Spoke excellent English, friendly, smiling and helpful. Room: Possibly the smallest I've ever had, but it was cosy, clean and charming. Beautiful decor. The bathroom is absolutely tiny; even at a diminutive 5'6'' I was struggling with it. Anyone over 6' tall would have problems. Having a shower was nigh on impossible due to the low, sloping ceiling. Solution - have a bath instead. Food: Breakfast good, typical small hotel fare. No evening meals but there are so many options in Venice it really doesn't matter. Reductions are offered at a nearby restaurant for residents of the Arlecchino. Overall: You have to see Venice. You just have to. This hotel is one that I shall be frequenting for years to come, and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a decent hotel for a reasonable price, in a good location, but doesn't care about room size.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the location”
Reviews.Author: RichardSWirral
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a fantastic break to Venice which is in no small part due to the hotel my wife chose. As many others have said previously, the best thing about this hotel is its location. Within 5 minutes of arriving at the Piazzale Roma bus station our bags were checked at the hotel and we were wandering around the streets. We spent the next few hours feeling rather smug as we passed numerous other tourists huffing and puffing with their bags over the myriad of bridges trying to find their hotels. When we arrived back, our bags had been taken up to our room for us, which was a nice touch. As for the hotel itself, I would say it is a decent three star. The room we had (806) is highly recommended. It appears to be the largest room on the floor with a view of the canal from each of the two windows. The room, whilst not huge, was big enough for a king size bed, small bureau and sofa. The bathroom was very clean and had all the necessary amenities (save for a shower curtain). The room looked a little tired but was cleaned every day with fresh towels provided if needed. Included in the price is a good continental breakfast. If you like sweet things for breakfast, you will be in heaven. There are lots of cakes and croissants to be had together with a selection of meats and cheeses. The coffee they serve was better than some we bought in cafes. The front desk guys were also great and seemed to speak just about any language you need. They were all very helpful and gave honest advice (even advising us not to take certain trips as they were overpriced). As for Venice, the usual highlights are advised. St Markâ€™s square is beautiful as is the Basilica. We would both strongly recommend the â€˜Secret Tourâ€™ at the Dogeâ€™s Palace. The guide is very stern (laughably so at times) but also very knowledgeable. It is well worth the extra couple of Euros. The water buses are also a great way to get around; we bought a three day pass for around â‚¬30. We could then hop on and off as we wanted and even managed to fit in a trip to the Lido. Overall, Venice was great and the hotel, whilst not being particularly grand or in a trendy part of town, was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: carolineEssexEngland
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a three night stay in venice.this hotel is so convienient for the bus stops and railway station as it is a few minutes walk from piazza roma the hub of all the actv network. our room was small but very clean and well maintained with a new bathroom .our room also had canal views which was a bonus. the breakfast buffett was well catered with a good choice of different options to please most people. i would recommend this hotel to anyone and we hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: katcornwall
Reviews.Content: The best value hotel I have stayed in for ages. The staff were very welcoming with excellant english and advice. The rooms were bright and airy, ours had two windows looking out onto the canals. The rooms were also exceptionally clean - no doubt thanks to Betty the housekeeper. The only downside was that there were no shower curtains, and like the other reviewer I ended up a paddling pool. breakfast was good but no toast! The location is also perfect, litterally 2 minutes from the bus station and vaparetto stop and yet absolutely no noise. Although at first it seems like you on the outskirts - you really arent as its 15 minute to the main tourist attractions with many lovely cafe's, shops and bars to visit on the way - the bar infront of the hotel s front door is great and the restaurant next to it is really nice. After taking the advice of the previous reviewer the best restaurant was MURA in the fish market.. Quite a lot of other restaurants tended to be samey with not so great 'classics'. I would definately return to the hotel and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel in Venice you can drive to!”
Reviews.Author: WalesBill
Reviews.Content: We returned at the end of November 2007 from a four day break in Venice. We had never been before but were enchanted. Staying at the three star Arlecchino Hotel, which is close to the bus station and water taxi terminus, we felt we had discovered a gem. The hotel is ideally situated for walking, eating and yes, driving! It is very close to a sister hotel the Best Western 'Olympia' where we were welcome to use their facilities too. Bed and Breakfast only accommodation is all that is available but the breakfast, although continental, is varied, plentiful and has healthy options. The surroundings are clean, typically Venitian, and overlook a bustling canal. This is a very easy and safe city for culture lovers, walkers, and foodies. Every corner on every street or canal is a delight to the artist or photographer. Highly recommended for couples and able bodied walkers.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with a resaonable price”
Reviews.Author: travels039
Reviews.Content: The Arlecchino is a 3 star hotel located very close to the bus station and water bus terminal. We were worried that it might be noisey and /or rough therefore but it certainly wasn't. St Mark's square is a pleasant walk - about 20 mins or take the water bus. It is great to get off the bus (by road) from Marco Polo airport at a cost of 3 euro's each for a single trip and within 2 mins you are at your hotel. The hotel rooms are quite small but they are nicely furnished and clean and an excellent price. Breakfast is served over looking one of the many canal's. The choice at breakfast is excellent and the staff are very obliging (cold food ony). There is a good bar straight infront of you when you come out of the door by reception. Don't go to the restaurant round the corner from the hotel - by the canal on the same side - I think it is called Brescia - not great food and although the food in Venice is quite expensive anyway this was way too much for the 'quality' Best restaurant we found was MURO by the fish market near to the Rialto Bridge (Rialto San Polo 222) - quite pricey but well worth it as long as you are willing to wait - the service is very slow but then everything is cooked freshly so can't have it all ways.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended. Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: justthetwoofus333333
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at this hotel and thought it was fab. Smallish bedroom but the view over the canals more than made up for it! Good quality clean accommodation with helpful & friendly staff. Continental breakfast was more than adequate. Location was ideal on the junction of several canals with lots of little bridges. 2mins walk from the main bus station (bus direct from airport) and 2mins from main waterbus terminus for boats to all over Venice. Highly recommended. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole030
Reviews.Content: My 20 year old daughter and I spent one night at the Arlecchino Hotel pre-cruise May 2007. I had researched the internet looking for a hotel close to the bus terminal in Venice. Easily saw the hotel when we got off the bus from the airport. Reception staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a standard Italian one (meat,cheese, cereals, brioche and coffee). Neighbourhood has character. Our room, although small by North American standards, was well appointed and very comfortable. We were on the top floor, room was very quiet and overlooked the back of the hotel. We easily walked to all the sights and the vaporetto is very close by. Many good restaurants nearby. Only took several minutes for us to walk to the free cruise ship shuttle to get to our ship. I would highly recommend the Arlecchino Hotel to anyone wanting to stay closer to the bus or train station.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the Arlecchino”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasGardener
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights during the last week of February. Our room was great! The hotel was clean and neat, the bathroom was exceptional, the breakfast was good, and the desk staff were very helpful. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel100
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was in good condition, right next to the bus terminal which was very convienent for getting the the airport, it cost only 3 euros and you can buy the ticket from the driver. It got a little noisy in the morning around 8:00am. The rep that was there at night was not very friendly or helpful at all. We were upgraded to another room becuase we requested two double beds and they had a queen booked for us. The breakfast is average. Yogurt, salami, cheese, bread, juice, coffee. No eggs or hot food of any sort. They serve breakfast from 7:30-10;30. the staff their was very friendly. The bathroom was really nice and the room was above average. The public water bus is around the corner, and was very convienent. It was a nice hotel but I would prefer to stay closer to St Mark's

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mont244
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Rome and Venice over Thanksgiving '06 with daughter. Had three days in Venice - staying at the Arlecchino Hotel. I wont expand on previous reviews, in terms of location, other than to chorus that the location is just outstanding - both for our arrival by train at Santa Lucia, and departure by bus to Marco Polo. The hotel room was surprisingly spacious. Having come from a tiny room in Rome - the Arlecchino was big by comparison. Bright and airy - it even had large couch to relax on. In the 'luxuries' department - bar fridge, well appointed bathroom (albeit a shower curtain would have made a massive improvement to the shower over the bath) and satellite TV (two English channels). The breakfast was good - simple fare but filling (the Italian pastry was delicious). Staff were very friendly, accomodating and helpful. Overall - the Arlecchino was a very good find. Compared to our digs in Rome it felt more like a five star! Location was just superb. I would certainly stay again - and would strongly recommend for those astute travelers looking for good valued accommodation that delivers.
